title: Midnight Chase
gameText: Play this card on any Agent to immediately skip one combat round for that Agent. The Agent takes no damage that round and may not deal any damage either.
dialogue: "Well, whatever it is you do believe, Scully…when you walk into that room nothing sacred will hold." - Mulder

title: Identity Intrusion
gameText: Play this card to gain control of an Agent during a single Combat round (your choice).
dialogue:
Scully: "What does that mean?"
Mulder: "It means... It means whatever you want it to mean. Good night."

title: Hostages
gameText: Play after an Adversary card has been successfully played on a Site. Discard a card from your hand to add X [CP] to your pool. X = Half the cost of the Adversary played (rounded down).
dialogue: "I just want to say that I believe you." - Kimberley

title: Field Treatment
gameText: Play on any Agent in the Field to immediately heal 2 points of damage after an LRC round.
dialogue: "This is Albert Hosteen. He's been translating your files." - Scully

title: FBI Crossroads
gameText: Play this card during a LONG RANGE COMBAT round on a combatant you control with a LRC skill. That combatant and one other combatant of the owning player's choice will deal no damage in this LRC round. Additionally, reduce any combatant's HEALTH by two during the Combat.
dialogue:
Scully: "Damn it, Skinner!
Mulder: "Drop your weapon!"
Skinner: "Back off!"

title: FBI Raid
gameText: Play this card during a combat on a Team of Agents to reduce damage from an Adversary's LRC by two points. The team still deals damage during that LRC round.
dialogue: Scully: "Mulder! The landlady's body! We found her in the bathroom!"

title: Emergency Evacuation
gameText: Play this card at the end of any Combat round to allow up to two Agents in that Team to leave the Combat if their HEALTH was not reduced to zero yet. Both Agents may still contribute their skills to other skill checks and be moved to the Hospital this turn.
dialogue: "I want an apology for the truth." - Mulder

title: Hidden Twin-Barrell
gameText: Play this card on any combatant to increase or decrease that Combatant's LRC by two points during that round.
dialogue: "It's open. Can I help you?" - Geraldine

title: Agent Medical Escort
gameText: One Agent (your choice) may immediately "escort" another Agent in the same Team if forced to go to the Hospital (only if chosen Agent is not required to go to the Hospital too). The escorted Agent may remove three additional points of damage while being accompanied during the next healing phase.
dialogue: "I just wanted to make sure you got where you were going safely." - Scully

title: Battle Expertise
gameText: Target Agent or Adversary gains an extra LRC/CRC bonus skill equal to the number of Combat cards in your Discard pile.
dialogue: "He's got a gun" - Mulder

title: B.A.T.F. Reinforcements
gameText: Play this card on target Team during a Combat to get an extra combatant in that Team with following skills: LRC: 3, CRC: 2, HEALTH: 5. Discard this card after the Combat phase has ended.
dialogue:
Mulder: "Is there contact with the temple?"
Agent: "If you call that contact."

title: Adversary's Rebirth
gameText: Play this card on an Evolutionary Adversary immediately after the Combat has ended, when that Adversary played is sent to the Discard Pile. You can start another Combat with the same Adversary for half cost (rounded up) against the same Team of Agents.
dialogue: Scully: "Mulder, I don't know what you're getting at here. Regeneration of an entire body?. I don't know why I'm standing here listening to this."

title: Renewed Threat
gameText: Play this card at the end of a Combat round on any Adversary card you control to return that Adversary card back to your hand only if the Adversary has not been defeated yet at the end of that round. You can play the Adversary card again (usual rules and cost).
dialogue: Mulder: "If Modell makes it through surgery, I want to be the first person that he talks to."

title: Opening Fire
gameText: Play on any combatant during one LRC round. That combatant will deal damage to their opponents first. If the HEALTH value of any opponent reaches zero after applying modifiers or healing cards, that combatant is sent to the Hospital and cannot deal any damage back that round.
dialogue: Mulder: "You murdered my father, you killed Scully's sister, and if Scully dies, I will kill you."

title: Quick Strike
gameText: Play on any combatant during one CRC round. That combatant will deal damage to their opponents first. If the HEALTH value of any opponent reaches zero after applying modifiers or healing cards, that combatant is sent to the Hospital and cannot deal any damage back that round.
dialogue: "Don't telegraph that left, Dre. Stevie Wonder would see that one coming. You're fighting the FBI now, Dre. Fight smart. Go!" - Skinner's coach

title: Masked Identity
gameText: Play this card any time during a Combat on any Adversary. If the Adversary's HEALTH was not reduced to zero yet, you may allow that Adversary to end Combat and return the card to your hand, but you cannot play the Adversary again this turn.
dialogue: "I like to say whoever God didn't get around to creating in his own image, it's our job to recreate in ours." - Doctor Kaplan

title: FBI and SWAT Strike
gameText: Play this card on any Agent during LONG RANGE COMBAT to add 2 points to that Agent's LRC skill. Additionally, if there is a CRC round, you can reduce the damage from any source by 2 points.
dialogue: "Federal agent, I'm armed! Exit the vehicle, now!" - Mulder

title: Suicide Run
gameText: Play this card on any Team of Agents at the end of any Combat round. If the Adversary you control is still alive, you may discard the Adversary to send to the Hospital any one Agent in the Team (your choice). That Agent is reduced to zero HEALTH.
dialogue: "He's got a bomb. He's got a bomb. He's got a bomb. He's got a bomb. He's got a bomb..." - Mulder

title: Virtual Training
gameText: This card adds 2 points to an Agent's LRC or CRC skill (your choice) during the Combat.
dialogue:
Scully: "Where's Mulder?"
Langly: "Mulder's in level one."

title: Hand Bind
gameText: Play this card during a CLOSE RANGE COMBAT round on any Adversary with the Keyword PRIMORDIAL or that is capable of using MARTIAL ARTS cards. The Adversary may bind an Agent (your choice), preventing that Agent from dealing damage during the remaining CRC rounds.
dialogue: "Go back to hell!" - Scully

title: Ammunition Reload
gameText: Play this card on any Agent during a LONG RANGE COMBAT round to double that Agent's LRC skill. This effect must be applied before any other modifier and only over the LRC listed on that Agent's card.
dialogue: "Protect me and mine with your quickening power." - Jared Chirp

title: Serpent Siege
gameText: Play this card on any PRIMORDIAL Adversary. One of that Adversary's opponents (your choice) is paralyzed and will deal no damage during the next round of Combat.
dialogue: "Help!" - Mulder

title: Backheld
gameText: Play this card on any combatant in a CLOSE RANGE COMBAT round to reduce the damage from any one source by one point.
dialogue: "Let him go, you hear me? Let him go!" - Reyes

title: Elusive Fugitive
gameText: Play on any PAWN or PRIMORDIAL Adversary to negate all damage allocated to that Adversary this round.
dialogue: "Hold the line, gentlemen! Look left! Look right! Hold the line!" - Agent Drummy

title: Smoke Grenade
gameText: Play this card on any combatant during a LONG RANGE COMBAT round to reduce the damage from all opponent sources by one point.
dialogue: "Oh God, John, they're smoking us out. John, I need you here. I need you to focus here John." - Agent Reyes

title: Tossing Maneuver
gameText: Negates the effects of any one Equipment card that adds to CLOSE RANGE COMBAT Skill for the duration of this combat.
dialogue: "Knowle Rohrer? It can't be. I watched Knowle Rohrer die." - Doggett

title: Evasive Adversary
gameText: Play on any PRIMORDIAL Adversary to reduce damage from all opponent LONG RANGE COMBAT or CLOSE RANGE COMBAT sources by 1 this round.
dialogue: "We have an agent alone with a sicko who cutting out women's tongues, a guy known for his vanishing act." - Doggett

title: Women's Health Clinic
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question.
dialogue: "If Anything should happen to me, or if we become separated, you must meet me here: 1255 91st St. Richville, M.D." - Note to Fox Mulder from Samantha Mulder

title: Tracking the Killer
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question.
dialogue: "The deaths follow a pattern. New Jersey, New York, Scranton, and then an ad is placed here in Binghamton looking for a man exactly like the others. The killer is moving in a northerly direction." - Mulder

title: Scully's Dream
question: You may ask one METHOD question.
dialogue: "To fit in with her brothers, Dana also shot a snake." - Margaret Scully

title: US Naval Station, San Diego
question: You may ask one METHOD, one RESULT or one MOTIVE question.
dialogue:
Morgan: "What the hell is that?"
Mulder: "Looks like the fuselage of a plane."

title: Zelma's Palm Readings, North Minneapolis, MN
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question.
dialogue: "The palms tell me all." - Madame Zelma

title: Kallencheck's Salvage Brokers, San Francisco, CA
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one METHOD question.
dialogue: "Actually I'd rather know who sold you the secret." - Mulder

title: Route 320-A, Craiger, Maryland
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one MOTIVE question.
dialogue: "This place isn't even on the map. How'd you get here?" - Skinner

title: Chaco Chicken Plant, Dudley, AR
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one METHOD question.
dialogue: "Chickens feed on chickens?" - Mulder

title: Zeus Storage, Maryland
question: You may ask one METHOD question.
dialogue: "All right, the number belongs to a company called Zeus Storage." - Pendrell

title: Norristown, Pennsylvania
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one MOTIVE question.
dialogue: "Roche drove a white El Camino, Scully. I saw it in my dream…" - Mulder

title: Tunguska, Siberian Forest, Russia
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one METHOD question.
dialogue: Mulder: "June 30, 1908. Tungus tribesmen and Russian fur traders look up into the southeastern Siberian sky and see a fireball streaking to Earth. When it hit the atmosphere, it created a series of cataclysmic explosions that are considered to be the largest single cosmic event in the history of civilization. Two thousand times the force of the bomb that was dropped on Hiroshima."

title: Barnes Cornes, NY
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one METHOD question.
dialogue:
Mulder: "Excuse me, sir, Max Fenig?"
Gardener: "Over there."

title: Coats Grove, MI
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one MOTIVE question.
dialogue: Scully: "What I have concluded is that this man's head was held forcibly down in the Michigan mud just a little too long."

title: San Diego County Hospital, CA
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one MOTIVE question.
dialogue: Scully: "Do you think I don't want what's best for this child? Do you think that I'm not trying to save her life?"

title: Caledonia, WI
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one METHOD question.
dialogue: "It's too late to help me. I can't help myself anymore." - Skur

title: Crump Residence, Montello, NE
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one RESULT question.
dialogue: Scully: "The pathology of this thing… It affects the inner ear and this area right here is ground zero. What if what we're looking for is some kind of a sound?"

title: 1501, Larkspur Lane, Maryland
question: You may ask one METHOD question.
dialogue:
Mulder: "You don't believe in ghosts?"
Scully: "That surprises you?"

title: Berkowitz House, Indiana, IN
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "That repulsive physiognomy is the vilest perversion of science." - Pollidori

title: Cradock Marine Bank, 8th St, Washington D.C.
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one METHOD question.
dialogue: "You can end this the right way." - Mulder

title: The Falls at Arcadia, San Diego County, CA
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one MOTIVE question.
dialogue: "So is this the American dream? This place?" - Scully

title: Hollins, Roanoke County, VA
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one RESULT question. If you ask if the MOTIVE is "Control", the skill check prerequisite is 4+.
dialogue:
Scully: "This isn't an X-File?"
Mulder: "Call it what you like. Here in Roanoke they're calling it a demon baby snatching."

title: FPS Corporate Offices, Inland Empire, CA
question: You may ask one RESULT question.
dialogue: Langly: "How do you kill something that won't die?"

title: T3 Connection, Fairfax County, Virginia
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question.
gameEffect: Bluffs played at this Site cost 1 additional [CP].
dialogue: "Yeah, I've found something down in Fairfax County. A derelict chicken farm with a T3 connection, paid for by Aleph Industries, Palo Alto, of which there's no other record anywhere." - Mulder

title: Foum Tataouine, Tunisia
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "He's seen more than he should have." - The Cigarette Smoking Man

title: Ivory Coast, West Africa
question: You may ask one METHOD question or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "I, too, am a professor of biology at the university but, uh, hardly one qualified to say what must have gone on here." - Amina Ngebe

title: Pittsfield, VI
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one RESULT question.
dialogue:
Scully: "What'd you expect them to find, Mulder?"
Mulder: "I don't know. A vortex, like the one in Oregon. Gravitational aberrations, unique chemical compositions, uh, relics that would indicate that the cave was a sacred site."

title: Santa Monica Peer, Los Angeles, CA
question: You may ask one MOTIVE, one METHOD or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "Bosco's passes with the cups and balls. Wah-day… Chubio… Colerader. Three gone… And yet, three return." - Maleeni

title: Galpex-Orpheus Platform, Gulf of Mexico
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "That has radioactive properties and can take over a man's body. And it's part of an alien conspiracy to colonise the planet, if I'm not mistaken." - Doggett

title: Mount Weather Complex, Bluemont, VA
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question or one METHOD question. Prerequisites of this card may not be changed by any card.
dialogue: "Would you defend a man who believes in aliens against the FBI and the military? " - Mulder

title: First Cavalry Church, Nova, VA
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION or one METHOD question.
dialogue: "I always said there's three kinds of people in the world: Them who make things happen, them who watch things happen and them who wonder what happened. I made things happen." - Terrance Pruit

title: Somerset, West Virginia, VA
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION, one METHOD or one RESULT question.
dialogue:
"Keep it straight! 
Come on, straight." - Mosley Drummy

title: Sangradura, Mexico
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION, one MOTIVE, or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "Hey, guard! Come here! Andale! Hey, guard! Somebody come here!" - Doggett

title: Inova Fairfax Medical Campus, Falls Church, VA
question: You may ask one MOTIVE question or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "She's not gone. Not her soul." - A. Pauley

title: FBI King County Crime Lab, Seattle
prerequisite: Special Equipment required or discard a Witness card from your hand.
gameEffect: Put a token on one of the Agents in the Team investigating this Site. Discard it to gain a +1 on any Site skill check made by any Team that Agent belongs to.
dialogue: "It's industrial-grade lead, used for weighing scuba divers and lining X-ray vests." - John Amis

title: Field Office Crime Lab (FBI)
prerequisite: Special Equipment required or discard a Witness card from your hand.
gameEffect: Put a token on one of the Agents in the Team investigating this Site. Discard it to gain a +1 on any Site skill check made by any Team that Agent belongs to.
dialogue: "It's your sister. We just pulled her body out of the river." - Scully

title: Field Office Crime Lab (FBI)
prerequisite: Special Equipment required or discard a Witness card from your hand.
gameEffect: Put a token on one of the Agents in the Team investigating this Site. Discard it to gain a +1 on any Site skill check made by any Team that Agent belongs to.
dialogue: "Agent Mulder, Scully. They killed a US Marshal and then shot Agent Fowley." - Skinner

title: Phil's Diner
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION question.
dialogue: "The town was founded back in the 20s when some of Barnum and Bailey's troops started coming down here during the winter off-season." - Hamilton

title: Area 51, Groom Lake, NV
question: You may ask one AFFILIATION or one METHOD question.
dialogue: "Some whistle-blower working inside the so-called Area 51. Said he had some "big deal" information. I got to tell you... The whole thing turned out to be just one gigantic mistake on our part." - Mulder

title: Kroner, Kansas
question: You may ask one RESULT question.
dialogue: "Well, this is not without historical precedent. The Old West was full of traveling men who claimed to be rainmakers. The Pueblo Indians even had a rain dance.." - Mulder

title: Foster City, CA
question: You may ask one MOTIVE or one RESULT question.
dialogue: "Mulder, that's what his autopsy shows. From the wound pattern to the blood spray... this man did it to himself, there's no question." - Scully

title: Josepho's Prophecy
gameText: Play this card on a Site. For each card in your hand with the Keyword ALIEN, ALIEN INVESTIGATION, or BEHAVIORAL that you reveal to your opponent, increase the Site's Pre-requisite by 1.
dialogue: "You want to see your son? You come alone and you follow my instructions to the letter." - Josepho

title: Unearthly Exposure
gameText: Place this card on any Agent in the Field investigating a Site with two tokens on it. The Agent is removed from play. Remove one token during each of the controlling player's Healing Phases. When no tokens remain, move the Agent to the Field.
dialogue: Prisoner: "I will die in an experiment when there is no longer any use for me." Mulder: "What kind of experiment?
createdBy: Alfredo Sánchez, Robert Czepiel, Greg Fremaux

title: Restricted Access Notice
gameText: Play this card to force an opponent Team currently investigating a Site to make an OBSERVATION 4+ skill check. If they fail only Agents with the Keyword FBI may contribute their skills to any skill check made on this Site.
dialogue: "As of an hour ago, they pumped concrete into the cave. Sealed it for precautionary reasons." - Mulder

title: Manipulating the Flock
gameText: Place this card next to a Site card as a Resource. The next card your opponent plays at this Site must be discarded with no effect after it is paid for, except for cards that negate this card or Combat cards. Then, discard this card. If no such card is played, this card remains in play until the Site is discarded.
dialogue: "I'm telling you the truth. I only want to help these people." - Absalom

title: Burning Loyalties
gameText: Play this card to negate one Witness RESOURCE immediately or to prevent the investigating player from playing any Witnesses while investigating this Site, except for Witnesses which would specifically negate this card.
dialogue: "The eyes are the windows of the soul. They tell you everything you need to know about a person. So tell me, are you lying?" - Dwight Cooper

title: Weakening Grip
gameText: Discard a card at random from your opponent's hand for each Agent investigating this Site.
dialogue: "What does Rawls want? The money? $90,000 from the Bay Saint Louis robbery?" - Mulder

title: Covering the Killer
gameText: Play this card on a Team investigating a Site to increase that Site Prerequisite by two.
dialogue: "I protected you as long as I could. I won't any longer." - Karin Berquist

title: Paralyzing Terror
gameText: If the Team successfully investigates this Site, the Investigation phase ends immediately. Any other Site cards in play without Bluff cards attached must be discarded.
dialogue: "Relax! Stop struggling! Stop it!" - Skinner

title: Die Wahrheit ist irgendwo da draußen
gameText: Play this card to force an opponent Team currently investigating a Site to make a SUBTERFUGE 4+ skill check. If they fail only Agents with the Keyword FBI may contribute their skills to any skill check made on this Site.
dialogue: Mulder: "This ship's been caught in something called the devil's triangle. It's some kind of time warp. A rift in space."

title: Files in Flames
gameText: Play this card on a Site only when your opponent is about to ask a new question about your X-File characteristic. If the question is answered with "yes" you may immediately replace your current X-File card with a different X-File card.
dialogue: "This was all strategized - every move. I just couldn't see it. It was all of a plan." - Mulder

title: Ultimate Deception
gameText: Force an opposing Agent (your choice) to go to the Hospital immediately and may not contribute to the Site skill check. The Agent takes two points of damage and must be fully healed to leave the Hospital.
dialogue: "Every minute of every day we choose. Who we are. Who we forgive. Who we defend and protect." - Skinner

title: Critical Countdown
gameText: If your opponent plays any card on this Site, it will automatically cause two points of damage to every Agent in a Team investigating the Site. If you play any card, empty your [CP] pool afterwards.
dialogue: "We got no time Dana. We'll find another way." - Agent Doggett

title: Limited Choices
gameText: Play this card to cause the Investigating player to discard X number of cards (chosen randomly) from his hand. X = [CP] cost paid.
dialogue: "No one believes me. I'm an annoyance to my superiors, a joke to my peers. They call me Spooky. Spooky Mulder." - Mulder

title: Too Close to the Truth
gameText: Play this card to allow you to exchange [CP] Pools with your opponent.
dialogue: "Your aliens, Agent Mulder. Your little green men arrived here millions of years ago." - Well-Manicured Man

title: Linda Bowman
gameText: Play on a Team of three or more Agents investigating a Site. Only Agents with at least one of the skills listed in that Site prerequisite may participate in any skill check or Combat at this Site.
dialogue: "After what they've done, do you think I'd let them get away with this? I'm gonna finish what you started." - Linda Bowman

title: Electric Anomalies
gameText: All Agents in a Team must discard all attached Keyword ELECTRICAL Equipment immediately.
dialogue: "The entire electrical system was shorted out. All the circuitry and wiring had melted." - Scully

title: Rigged Lottery
gameText: Play this card to examine your opponent's hand and force that player to discard X cards (your choice).
dialogue: "They're all the same! This game is fixed." - Glen Chao

title: The Right Hand's Toll
gameText: Pay 2 [CP] to move up to 3 [RP] from your opponent's [RP] pool to your [CP] pool immediately.
dialogue: "Name's Nathaniel Teager. 26 confirmed solo enemy kills. A veritable killing machine. Left for dead by the same government that created him." - Denny Markham

title: Cerulean Hunt
gameText: You can change up to two cards from your hand with a similar number of Bluffs that you have already played on a Site and are still in play (face down). The new Bluffs under the Site can still be negated.
dialogue: "Appears as if he died from ingesting paint." - Scully

title: Voodoo Ritual
gameText: Play this card to decrease the cost of the first Adversary card you play in this Site by two.
dialogue: "…they're called "poppets". Inside you place three thorns of a blood red rose, a strand of hair and a photo of your victim. - Proprietor

title: Unexpected Stroke
gameText: Discard two cards from your hand (your choice) to apply a -2 modifier to any Agent's skill check on this Site.
dialogue: Nurse: "Mr. Hosteen cannot accept any visitors at this time."

title: They are Watching
gameText: Play this card to force your opponent to play with an open hand (all cards face up) until end of turn. If a card forces your opponent to discard any card randomly from their hand, you may choose them directly.
dialogue: "Dr. Sandoz, I don't know if this is a secure line." - Scully

title: Distracting Vision
gameText: Pick the top 5 cards from your Bureau deck and show them to your opponent. You may play one revealed Bluff card at half cost (rounded up). Shuffle the rest back into your Bureau deck.
dialogue: "According to Skinner's psychiatrist, he's been experiencing a recurring dream in which he's confronted by an old woman." - Scully

title: Mirage of Samantha
gameText: Choose one effect: Add 5 tokens to your [CP] pool or target player discards two cards at random from his hand.
dialogue: "I think people are looking hard for miracles… so hard that maybe they make themselves see what they want to see." - Mulder

title: Ghostly Haunting
gameText: Play this card to provide the keywords necessary to play any one Keyword PHENOMENA Adversary.
dialogue: "Dorothy! I need your help." - Leo Kreutzer

title: Trust Conflict
gameText: Discard X cards from your hand to draw X cards from the top of your Bureau deck.
dialogue: "Don't get me wrong. I love all music. But I prefer the stuff that lasts." - Mr. Burt

title: Charles Wesley Gotts
gameText: Play this card to provide the keywords necessary to play any one Keyword PAWN Adversary.
dialogue: "Who? Who's gunnin' for me?" - Charles Wesley Gotts

title: Shadowed Dealings
gameText: The printed cost of any Bluff played at this Site is halved (rounded up).
dialogue: "Tell him what he wants to hear." - The Cigarette-Smoking Man

title: Haunting Trickery
gameText: Flip the top card of your Bureau deck (flip enough cards until getting a card with a cost number). Use that number as a negative skill modifier on target Agent's skill (your choice) until end of turn. The chosen skill cannot decrease below zero. Shuffle the Drawn cards into the Bureau deck afterwards.
dialogue: Lyda "You look like you saw a ghost. There are ghosts in this house, you know…"

title: Biochip Implant
gameText: Attach this card to any Agent in the Field to reduce their HEALTH by one. Opponents may play ALIEN MANIPULATION cards that affect that Agent at half cost (rounded up). Discard this card if the Agent visits the Hospital or if the Team he belongs makes a successful MEDICAL or SCIENCES +7 skill check.
dialogue: "It's the same thing I had removed from my own neck." - Scully
createdBy: Alfredo Sánchez, Robert Czepiel, Greg Fremaux

title: Unexpected Hospital Visit
gameText: You may attach this card to any Agent with cost of 5 [RP] or less. Each time this Agent is investigating a Site you may pay that cost to force that Agent to go to the Hospital (undamaged). This card is removed when a Healing card is played on the Agent.
dialogue: "He said I was the only one who'd believe him" – Diana Fowley

title: Never Again
gameText: Attach this card to any Agent in a Team investigating a Site to decrease all Agent's skills by one (LRC, CRC and HEALTH are not decreased). The final values cannot be negative. Discard this card when the Agent visits the Hospital.
dialogue: "Never say never. Yeah, sometimes I wish I were that impulsive." - Scully

title: Psychotic Episodes
gameText: Attach this card to any Agent in the Field to lower the Agent's skill levels by one for each additional Agent in their Team. This change includes LRC, CRC, RES, and HEALTH. The final values cannot be negative. Discard this card if the Agent visits the Hospital.
dialogue: "Mulder, this is not reality. This is a hallucination. It has to be. And either I am having it, or you are having it or we are having it together." - Scully

title: Persuasive Push
gameText: Choose an Agent on a Team already assigned to a Site. The chosen Agent contributes a skill value of zero for the Site Prerequisites.
dialogue: "All right, where's my next bread crumb?" - Mulder

title: Hog Hideout Hazard
gameText: Force an opposing Team to make a SUBTERFUGE 4+ skill check. If they fail, choose one Agent to go to the Hospital (undamaged).
dialogue: "Is there some secret farmer trick to get these things moving?" - Mulder

title: Alien Abduction
gameText: Force a Team in the Field to make an ALIEN INVESTIGATION 4+ skill check. If they fail, attach this card to any Agent in that Team (your choice) and remove the Agent from play. During the next Agent's controller Healing phase, move the Agent to the Hospital (undamaged).
dialogue: "Agent Mulder?! Mulder!" - Skinner

title: Agent's Verschwinden
gameText: Select one Agent from the Team investigating this Site. That Agent, along with any attached cards, is placed face-up, twelve cards down, in the owning player's Bureau deck. When the Agent's card reaches the top of the deck, the Agent (and any attached cards) are immediately moved to the Field, undamaged.
dialogue: "Why? Why me, Gerry? Do I remind you of your sister? Why did your sister kill herself, Gerry?" - Scully

title: Shitstorming the X-Files
gameText: Play this card to change the Site Prerequisite from CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION to SCIENCES.
dialogue: "Get Out, Scully! This whole place could blow!" - Mulder

title: Frozen Vitrification
gameText: Play to change the Site Prerequisite from SCIENCES to BEHAVIORAL .
dialogue: Dr Yonechi: "Me? No, not yet. No one has solved vitrification."

title: Eyes of Obedience
gameText: Play to change the Site Prerequisite from CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION to OCCULT INVESTIGATION.
dialogue: Father Gregory: "Whatever your intentions… your secular prejudices blind you from seeing what's really happening here."

title: Blazzing Pages
gameText: Play to change the Site Prerequisite to OCCULT INVESTIGATION 3+.
dialogue: Scully: "Where are you going?" Mulder: "To see a man about a burning book."

title: Éí 'Aaníígóó 'Áhoot'é
gameText: Play to change a Site Prerequisite to ALIEN INVESTIGATION 3+.
dialogue: "It looks like Navajo. It was used during World War II. My father told me that it was the only code the Japanese couldn't break." - Scully

title: Dark Dealings
gameText: Subtract 4 from one Team's OCCULT INVESTIGATION or SUBTERFUGE skill check.
dialogue: "Please, don't take my baby! Please, don't take my baby! Wayne! Wayne!" - Laura Weinsider

title: Fingerprints Erased
gameText: Subtract 4 from one Team's ALIEN INVESTIGATION or EVIDENCE COLLECTION skill check.
dialogue:
Mulder: "Is that a watch?"
Scully: "Yeah."Mulder: "What does it read?
Scully: "Eight-oh-one."

title: Faith Departure
gameText: Subtract 4 from one Team's ALIEN INVESTIGATION or OCCULT INVESTIGATION skill check.
dialogue: "There are more worlds than the one you can hold in your hand." - Albert Hosteen

title: Scripted Fate
gameText: Write down the question you think your opponent will ask if successfully investigates this Site. Place this card on your opponent's Field with the paper underneath. If your opponent asks that question, you are not forced to answer it. Otherwise, add 2 [CP] to your [CP] pool. Discard this card afterwards.
dialogue: Scully: "How is it you think you know me so well, Mr. Padgett?" Phillip Padgett: "I'm writing about you."

title: Blevins' Inquiry
gameText: Force one Agent with the Keyword SKEPTIC (your choice) to go back to the Bureau immediately. The Agent may not contribute to any skill checks this turn.
dialogue: Blevins: "Agent Scully. Please have a seat."

title: Fateful Omen
gameText: Remove from play any Agent with the Keyword FBI in a Team investigating this Site. The Agent may not contribute their skills to any check this turn. Move the Agent back to the Field during the next Briefing Phase.
dialogue: "This card's not meant for me. It's yours." - Puppet

title: Inexplicable Mind Vibes
gameText: Move one Agent with the Keyword BELIEVER (your choice) to the Hospital immediately (undamaged). The Agent may not contribute to any skill checks this turn.
dialogue: "They are coming." - Mulder
createdBy: Alfredo Sánchez, Robert Czepiel, Greg Fremaux

title: Agent Gene Crane
gameEffect: Agent Crane's BUREAUCRACY and EVIDENCE COLLECTION skills are increased by one if he and Agent Doggett are on the same Team.
bio: Special Agent Gene Crane worked under Deputy Director Alvin Kersh, assisting in key cases like the search for Mulder and the Zeus Genetics investigation. In late 2001, he was replaced by a super soldier, as part of an alien plot.

title: Frank Black
gameEffect: Place 1 [RP] on this card. Discard this [RP] to look at the top two cards of your deck. Replace the [RP] during your Briefing Phase.
bio: Frank Black was a former FBI agent who left the bureau to become a freelance consultant. He specialized in criminal profiling and paranormal investigations, often working with the secretive Millennium Group. His psychic abilities, especially his ability to "see" through the eyes of criminals, helped him solve complex and often disturbing cases.

title: Agent Rice
gameEffect: Place two tokens on Agent Rice. Any time during a Combat involving Agent Rice you may discard one token to search through your Bureau deck and add a Combat card to your hand. Show the card to your opponent and shuffle the deck.
bio: Agent Rice led the SWAT response, coordinating with Scully during a hostage situation. Despite initial resistance, he contacted Mulder's captor, Gary Lambert, who demanded to broadcast a message, escalating the tense standoff.

title: Lieutenant Kraskow
gameEffect: Treat Lieutenant Kraskow's LRC skill as 4 if the number of agents in his Team is 4 or more.
bio: Lieutenant Kraskow is a SWAT team leader managing the crime scene during a bank robbery. He collaborates with FBI Agent Skinner, who is seeking his trapped agents, Mulder and Scully.

title: Cadet Rudolph Hayes
gameEffect: Rudolph Hayes' CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION and OCCULT INVESTIGATION skills are increased by one if he and Agent John Doggett are on the same Team.
bio: John Stuart Mimms, using the alias Rudolph Hayes, joined the FBI. He helped Agent John Doggett investigate his son's murder and the murders of two women. Mimms provided crucial information and was wrongly accused by A.D. Brad Follmer before proving his innocence.

title: Executive Assistant Arlene
gameEffect: Treat Arlene as RES 2 if she and Assistant Director Walter Skinner are both in the Bureau.
bio: Arlene worked as an executive assistant for the FBI. She helped Assistant Director Walter Skinner and the FBI investigate various cases and incidents, and was present during significant events involving Agents Fox Mulder and Dana Scully.

title: Forensic Analyst John Amis
gameEffect: John Amis has direct access to the Field Office Crime Lab even without any piece of equipment attached.
bio: John Amis worked as a forensic analyst at the King County Crime Lab. He helped his friend Craig Willmore, a Special Agent for the FBI Seattle field office, investigate the mystery of the Russian ship Tarakan, and was accidentally subjected to radiation poisoning.

title: Agent Hedin
gameEffect: Place two tokens on Agent Hedion. Discard one token to search through your Bureau deck and add any Keyword COMPUTER card to your hand. Show the card to your opponent and shuffle the deck.
bio: Agent Hedin assisted in the investigation by matching fingerprints found on the stairwell to Michael Kritschgau, an employee of the Pentagon's research division, leading to a pivotal breakthrough in identifying Scully's attacker.

title: Detective Pennock
gameEffect: Place a token on this card. Remove a token to look through your Bureau deck to draw any keyword CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your Bureau deck.
bio: Lloyd Pennock was part of the local police force in Wilmington, Delaware. He investigated a murder at Paradise Motel and encountered Marty Glenn, a blind woman, near the victim. Collaborating with Mulder and Scully, Pennock navigated the enigma, maintaining an open mind in uncovering Marty's mysterious Capabilities.

title: Assistant Director Brad Follmer
gameEffect: Place two tokens on this card. Discard a token to add 1 to Follmer's BUREAUCRACY or OBSERVATION skill.
bio: Assistant Director Brad Follmer had a romantic history with Monica Reyes that he briefly brought up while trying to keep her away from the X-Files. Despite his political maneuvers and skepticism towards the X-Files, he aided Doggett in a crucial investigation. However, his involvement in organized crime tainted his reputation, leaving his future uncertain, possibly facing criminal charges.

title: SAC Fossa
gameEffect: Treat SAC Fossa as a RES 2 if she is in the Bureau. If Fossa is in the same Team as Agent Mosley Drummy and/or ASAC Dakota Whitney, she gains +1 to her COMPUTER and SCIENCES skills.
bio: Special Agent in Charge Fossa was a senior member of the FBI. She was part of an FBI team that consecutively searched for missing Agent Monica Bannan and then Cheryl Cunningham.

title: ASAC Dakota Whitney
gameEffect: ASAC Dakota Whitney's OBSERVATION and CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skills are increased by one if she and Agent Mosley Drummy are on the same Team.
bio: Dakota Whitney is an ASAC and a Special Agent in Charge at the FBI. While investigating the deaths of multiple abductees, she was instrumental in arranging the involvement of Agents Mulder and Scully.

title: Agent Mosley Drummy
gameEffect: Place a token on this card. Discard a token and look through your Bureau deck to draw any one Equipment card that increases CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skill. Add it to your hand. Reshuffle your Bureau Deck.
bio: FBI Agent Mosley Drummy led investigations, aiding in high-profile cases alongside Mulder and Scully. Known for skepticism, pivotal role in arrests, and leadership during crises. Involved in capturing notorious criminals, including modern-day Frankenstein Doctor.

title: Agent Leyla Harrison
gameEffect: Place 1 [RP] on this card. This [RP] may be used to pay for any Keyword CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION or OCCULT INVESTIGATION cards. If you spend this [RP], you may replace it during the Briefing Phase if Leyla Harrison is in the same Team as Agents Monica Reyes or John Doggett.
bio: Leyla Harrison was an agent assigned to the FBI. She transitioned from the accounting office to the X-Files unit. Leyla admirably pieced together Mulder and Scully's adventures, later assisting Reyes and Doggett in their investigations.

title: Agent Monica Reyes
gameEffect: If Agent Monica Reyes is in the Field, all Site cards with Keyword ALIEN INVESTIGATION or OCCULT INVESTIGATION may be played for 1 [RP] less.
bio: Assigned to the X-Files alongside Agent John Doggett, Monica Reyes was initially skeptical but later embraced belief in the paranormal. She's characterized by her intuition, open-mindedness, and spiritual inclinations. Reyes' dynamic nature adds depth to the investigative team, balancing skepticism with a willingness to explore unexplained phenomena.

title: Lizzy Gill
gameEffect: Lizzy Gill allows you to choose to add to the Conspiracy Pool instead of the Resource Pool during the Briefing Phase. Treat Lizzy Gill as RES 2 if she is in the same Team as Agent Scully. If so, Scully's HEALTH value is decreased by one.
bio: Lizzy Gill was introduced by Margaret Scully to assist during Scully's pregnancy. Later revealed as a scientist working for a faction interested in Scully's baby's genome. Despite suspicion, her actions imply Scully's baby is a natural miracle.

title: Agent John Doggett
gameEffect: Place one token on this card. Discard a token to negate one Bluff. Additionally, if Agent Doggett is on the same Team as Agent Scully, change her Keyword SKEPTIC to BELIEVER.
bio: John Doggett is a no-nonsense Agent who frequently applies his down to earth sensibilities. A former a marine and NYPD detective, Doggett joined The X-Files, partnering with Dana Scully and later Monica Reyes, investigating unsolved cases with mysterious or supernatural elements. His son Luke Doggett was abducted and murdered.

title: Agent Jeffrey Spender
gameEffect: Place one token on this card. Discard a token and look through your Bureau deck to draw any on Keyword MOTIVE or RESULT Site card. Add that card to your hand. Reshuffle your Bureau deck.
bio: Jeffrey Frank Spender is the son of the Cigarette Smoking Man and Cassandra Spender, as well as the paternal half-brother of Agent Fox Mulder. He worked as a Special Agent in the FBI, assigned to the X-Files unit, partnered with Agent Diana Fowley.

title: Conrad Lozano
gameEffect: Treat Agent Conrad Lozano as RES 1 if the Team he belongs makes an ALIEN INVESTIGATION 5+ skill during the Briefing Phase.
bio: Lozano is of Mexican descent but is American by nationality. He works at the INS Service Processing Center in Fresno, CA. Despite his skepticism, Lozano agrees to help Agent Mulder locate Eladio Buente, indicating his willingness to assist in the investigation despite his doubts about the supernatural elements involved.

title: Agent Flagler
gameEffect: Place two tokens on this card. Discard a token during your Briefing Phase as Active player to be able to purchase one additional card from your Bureau deck after the first purchase of cards. You must still pay for each card drawn this way.
bio: Agent Flagler is a meticulous investigator that analyzes evidence and handwriting samples for the FBI. Flagler's attention to detail contributed to unraveling a mysterious kidnapping case, collaborating with Mulder and Scully.

title: Agent Chesty Short
gameEffect: Place two tokens on this card. Discard a token during your Briefing Phase as Directed player to be able to purchase one additional card from your Bureau deck after the first purchase of cards. You must still pay for each card drawn this way.
bio: Agent Chesty Short is a bureaucratic figure that criticizes Mulder and Scully's investigations' expense and efficacy. He doubts their belief in aliens and symbolizes the bureaucratic skepticism that often opposes Mulder and Scully's pursuit of the paranormal.

title: Michael Lee Kritschgau
gameEffect: Place one token on Kritschgau. Discard one token to search through your Bureau deck and add a keyword BUREAUCRACY Witness card to your hand. Show it to your opponent and shuffle the deck. Additionally, if he is on the same Team as Agent Mulder, change Mulder's Keyword BELIEVER to SKEPTIC.
bio: Michael Kritschgau was an employee of the Department of Defense. He stole a core sample from an FBI lab and later revealed Mulder that UFO conspiracy was a cover-up for military experiments.

title: Detective John Kresge
gameEffect: If Detective Kresge is in the same Team as Agent Scully, they both gain a +1 to their cumulative OBSERVATION and CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skills, and a -1 to their SUBTERFUGE and EVIDENCE COLLECTION skills.
bio: Detective John Kresge was a seasoned San Diego police officer that assisted Agent Dana Scully in investigating Mrs. Roberta Sim's apparent suicide. He updated her on Marshall Sim's confession regarding the murder case. This interaction showcases Kresge's role as a reliable ally to Scully.

title: SAC Darius Michaud
gameEffect: Any time during the Game you can sacrifice SAC Darius Michaud. Remove the card from the Game. If so, you may ask any one Characteristic question regarding one opponent's X-File.
bio: Special Agent in Charge Darius Michaud played a significant role in the investigation of the mysterious bombing of a Federal Building in Dallas, Texas. He sacrificed himself in the building while searching for the bomb, demonstrating his dedication to duty and the safety of others.

title: Deputy Alvin Kersh
gameEffect: Treat Dep. Director Alvin Kersh as a RES 3 if he is in the Bureau Section of the table. Kersh also allows you to choose to add to the Conspiracy Pool instead of the Resource Pool during the Briefing Phase.
bio: Alvin Kersh obstructed Mulder and Scully's paranormal investigations, assigning them mundane tasks, later Overseeing their work. Kersh, a former U.S. Air Force pilot, brought military discipline to his role. His skepticism towards the X-Files drove bureaucratic actions, often impeding the Agents their pursuit of the Truth.

title: Agent Peyton Ritter
gameEffect: Agent Peyton Ritter's BUREAUCRACY skill is increased by one if he and Deputy Alvin Kersh are on the same Team. If Agent Peyton Ritter is in the same Team as Agent Dana Scully, she loses one HEALTH.
bio: Agent Peyton Ritter accompanied Scully to investigate Alfred Fellig, a crime scene photographer suspected of staging deaths. Ritter exhibited a single-minded focus on building a case against Fellig, disregarding Scully's cautious approach and revealing a dependency on the directives of his superior, Alvin Kersh.

title: Agent Diana Fowley
gameEffect: Agent Fowley allows you to choose to add to the Conspiracy Pool instead of the Resource Pool during the Briefing Phase. If Agent Fowley is in the same Team as Agent Dana Scully, both gain a -1 to their cumulative CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION and EVIDENCE COLLECTION skills.
bio: As an FBI Special Agent, Diana Fowley investigated Gibson Praise with Agent Spender before joining Mulder's search for an Alien Hybrid. Despite her involvement, her motivations remained mysterious, leading to speculation about her ties to the Syndicate and her role with Mulder.

title: Detective Norman
gameEffect: Detective Norman's LONG RANGE COMBAT skill is doubled against any EVOLUTIONARY adversary played on any Team he belongs. Additionally, if Detective Norman is in any Team including Fox Mulder, add 1 to Norman's CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skill.
bio: Norman was a detective with the Newark County Police Department who was Mulder's contact in New Jersey on what Mulder initially thought was a routine homicide investigation.

title: Agent Thomas
gameEffect: Place a [RP] token on this card. This may be used to pay for for any CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION or BEHAVIORAL cards. If you use this [RP], replace it during your briefing phase.
bio: Agent Thomas helped FBI agents Mulder and Scully to find traces that lead them to Lucas Henry, by showing Liz Hawley, a series of Polaroid photographs of a possible suspect.

title: Detective Barron
gameEffect: Place two tokens on Detective Barron. Discard a token to play a Bluff card from your hand at half its cost. Additionally, Barron's BEHAVIORAL and CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skills are increased by one if he and Agent Kelly Ryan are in the same Team.
bio: Barron was a detective with the Richmond, Virginia police and the superior of Kelly Ryan. He was an extremely short-tempered man who viewed the involvement of the FBI as an intrusion onto his turf.

title: Agent Ambrose Chapel
gameEffect: Place two tokens on Ambrose Chapel. Discard one token during any skill check to add 1 to Ambrose Chapel's ALIEN INVESTIGATION or SUBTERFUGE skill. If Ambrose Chapel's Team is attacked by the Alien Bounty Hunter, Chapel may not participate in the Combat, but he may still contribute to the Site skill check.
bio: Ambrose Chapel is an Agent that works for the Central Intelligence Agency (C.I.A.). He was impersonated by the Alien Bounty Hunter.

title: Detective Kelly Ryan
gameEffect: Place one token on Detective Kelly Ryan. Discard a token to look through your Bureau deck any time during the game to draw any one Bluff card. Show the Bluff to your opponent and shuffle the deck.
bio: Kelly Ryan became a detective with the Richmond Police Department in Virginia after being tutored as a student of Dana Scully. She asked for assistance from Scully and Mulder when investigating a bizarre series of murders and while searching for Dr. Chester Ray Banton.

title: Agent Craig Willmore
gameEffect: If Agent Craig Willmore is in the same Team as Agent Pendrell, Willmore gains a +1 to his COMPUTER and SCIENCES skills, and a -1 to his ALIEN INVESTIGATION skill.
bio: Craig Willmore is a Special Agent for the FBI field office in Seattle, Washington. On April 2, 1996, he was assigned to investigate the disappearance of Agents Fox Mulder and Dana Scully.

title: Computer Forensic Holly Rice
gameEffect: Place one token on this card. Remove one token to add a +1 modifier to any COMPUTER or EVIDENCE COLLECTION skill check made by the Team including Polly.
bio: Holly, a government worker for the FBI, worked in the Computer Records Office. Influenced by "Pusher" Robert Patrick Modell, she leaked confidential records. She also worked in the FBI Communications Center, investigating repeated calls to Skinner's floor, while remaining friends with Agent Dana Scully.

title: Detective Waltos
gameEffect: Place one token on Detective Waltos. Discard one token to search through your Bureau deck and add an Equipment card of cost not higher than 2 [RP]. Add it to your hand, reshuffle your Bureau deck. If the card drawn is the "Lie Detector" you may attach it to Waltos immediately for zero cost.
bio: Detective Waltos was in charge of the investigation into the murder of Carina Sayles, of which Assistant Director Walter Skinner was accused. Skinner, a suspect in the murder case, was uncooperative, refusing to take a lie-detector test.

title: Marita Covarrubias
gameEffect: If Marita Covarrubias is in the same Team as Agent Alex Krycek, they both gain +1 to their cumulative ALIEN INVESTIGATION and SCIENCES skills, and -1 to their CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION and EVIDENCE COLLECTION skills.
bio: Assistant to one of the Special Representatives of the of the UN Secretary General, Marita Covarrubias is a mysterious character with little know background who provided top secret information to Agent Fox Mulder, whilst working with The Cigarette-Smoking Man.

title: Agent Schoniger
gameEffect: Place a token on this card. Discard a token to move Agent Dana Scully from anywhere on the table to the Team Agent Schoniger is in. Scully may assist in any skill check made by the team. In this manner, Scully may assist on two Sites in one turn.
bio: Agent Schoniger, with 30 years of FBI experience, assists Scully in analyzing Mulder's hypnosis tape about Samantha's abduction, attributing Mulder's memories to compensatory fantasy, and believes Samantha was likely killed in 1973.

title: Vicki Burdick
gameText: Adds 3 to one Team's OBSERVATION or adds 2 to one Team's BEHAVIORAL skill check.
dialogue: "I've been running numbers here on the murder victims…and the strangest thing has come up." - Vicki Burdick

title: Audrey Pauley
gameText: Adds 2 to one Team's OBSERVATION or adds 1 to one Team's OCCULT INVESTIGATION skill check, or play this card when one of your Agents must go to the Hospital with zero HEALTH to remove half of the damage tokens (rounded up). The Agent must still go to the Hospital.
dialogue: "I told you. She's not gone." - Audrey Pauley

title: Marty Glenn
gameText: Place three tokens on this card. Discard a token to add 2 to one Team's CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skill check. You may discard a token once per turn. Discard this resource when all tokens have been discarded.
dialogue: "It's not magic. It's your crappy cologne. Who's that with you?" - Marty Glenn

title: John Lee Roche
gameText: Adds 2 to one Agent's CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skill check. Your opponent may pay 3 [CP] to negate this Witness.
dialogue: "You choose the one that was your sister, and I'll tell you where she is. Hey, come on, it's a fifty-fifty chance." - John Lee Roche
createdBy: Alfredo Sánchez, Robert Czepiel, Gregory Fremaux

title: Alvin Kurtzweil
gameText: Adds 1 [RP] to your pool every time a Keyword BUREAUCRACY or GOVERNMENT card is played.
dialogue: "There's something you don't know about the bombing in Dallas." - A. Kurtzweil

title: Father Joseph Crissman
gameText: Attach this Witness to any Agent in the Field. Adds 1 to that Agent's BEHAVIORAL skill once per turn while the Agent is in the Field. Discard this card when the Agent's HEALTH is reduced to 0.
dialogue: "This is where she was taken. This is where she was attacked." - Father Joe

title: Gibson Praise
gameText: Place this Witness card in the Bureau. You may attach it anytime to any Team of Agents in that section. If that Team successfully investigates a Site, you may ask "Is your X-File's Result Abduction?" in addition to the Site question for zero cost. Discard this card afterwards.
dialogue: "If they find me, they'll take me. I know it." - Gibson Praise

title: Sheriff Lucius Hartwell
gameText: Attach this Witness to any Agent in the Field. Adds 1 to that Agent's OCCULT INVESTIGATION skill once per turn while the Agent is in the Field. Discard this card when the Agent's HEALTH is reduced to 0. If played on Agent Dana Scully this card costs 1 [RP] less.
dialogue: Hartwell: "You really know your stuff, Dana."

title: Officer Keith Wetzel
gameText: Attach this Witness to any Agent in the Field. Adds 1 to that Agent's CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skill once per turn while the Agent is in the Field. Discard this card when the Agent's HEALTH is reduced to 0.
dialogue: "We came on this case looking for a werewolf, right?" - Mulder

title: Cassandra Spender
gameText: Adds zero to one Team's BUREAUCRACY or ALIEN INVESTIGATION skill check. If this card is used in a successful Site investigation, the owning player may ask "Is your X-File's Affiliation Alien?" in addition to the Site question for zero cost.
dialogue: "Cassandra Spender is, indeed, the mother of Agent Jeffrey Spender and the ex-wife of C.G.B. Spender. She was first abducted in 1973 on the night of November 27."

title: Sussane Modeski
gameText: Attach this Witness to any Agent in the Field. Adds 1 to that Agent's BUREAUCRACY skill once per turn while the Agent is in the Field. Discard this card when the Agent's HEALTH is reduced to 0.
dialogue: "I'll prove it to you, just help me decipher this." - Susanne

title: Esther Nairn
gameText: Play this card to negate the Adversary card 'Kill Switch'. Alternatively, you can attach Esther Nairn to any Agent in the Field to add 1 to that Agent's COMPUTER skill once per tur while the Agent is in the Field. Discard Esther Nairn when the Agent's HEALTH is reduced to 0.
dialogue:
Mulder: "Are you "Invisigoth?"
Esther: "How did you find me?"

title: Michelle Fazekas
gameText: Attach this Witness to any Agent in the Field. Adds 1 to that Agent's RES value during the Briefing Phase if that Agent is in the Field. Discard this card when the Agent's HEALTH is reduced to 0.
dialogue: "They appear to be human, but whoever left these uses the balls of his feet more like an animal." - Michelle Fazekas

title: Patti Rich
gameText: Adds 2 to one Team's BEHAVIORAL or adds 1 to one Team's OCCULT INVESTIGATION skill check.
dialogue: "They were real close when Bobby was little. Always kidding around and stuff. But Bobby sort of got into that teenage stage. He doesn't want to listen to nobody." - Patti Rich

title: Alfred Fellig
gameText: Adds 2 to the Agent's OCCULT INVESTIGATION skill check. Alternately, any card that would send Dana Scully to the Hospital may be negated by playing this card. If played this way, remove Alfred Fellig from the game. This card cannot be played during a Combat and it is not a Healing card.
dialogue: "Do you see him? Don't look. Close your eyes…" - Alfred Fellig

title: Melissa Riedal-Ephessian
gameText: Play to change the Site Prerequisite to OCCULT INVESTIGATION 3+.
dialogue: "We have come together in this life, this time. Only to meet in passing." - Melissa Riedal-Ephesian

title: Chuck Forsch
gameText: Adds 2 to one Team's OCCULT INVESTIGATION Or adds 1 to one Team's BEHAVIORAL skill check.
dialogue:
Scully: "Does anybody else know about these pictures, Chuck?
"Chuck: "Nurse Innes."

title: Dr. Simon Bruin
gameText: Adds 1 [RP] to your pool every time a Keyword SCIENCES or EVOLUTIONARY card is played.
dialogue:
Dr. Bruin: "You'd be amazed what I've seen removed from people's throats in emergency rooms."
Scully: "There's no mistake. This patient has no pituitary gland."

title: Sister Abigail
gameText: Adds 1 [RP] to your pool every time a Keyword BEHAVIORAL or SUBTERFUGE card is played
dialogue: "Please. I'm Sister Abby. This is Brother Oakley. We're all saddened by what has happened in your world, but it does not concern us." - Sister Abigail

title: Head Calusari
gameText: Adds 1 [RP] to your pool every time a Keyword PRIMORDIAL or OCCULT INVESTIGATION card is played.
dialogue: "The evil that is here has always been. It has gone by different names through history - Cain, Lucifer, Hitler. It does not care if it kills one boy or a million men. If you try to stop us, the blood will be on your hands." - Head Calusari

title: Jorge Concepción
gameText: Adds 1 [RP] to your pool every time a Keyword ALIEN INVESTIGATION or OBSERVATION card played
dialogue: "¡Por favor, no me lastime! ¡Yo tengo mucho miedo!" - Jorge

title: Jesse Landis
gameText: Adds 3 to one Team's BEHAVIORAL or adds 2 to one Team's CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skill check. If played after Adversary card "2Shy" attacked a Team, the cost of this card is halved.
dialogue: "I smelled her perfume. That's when I knew he was lying. She was wearing her perfume when she left for her class." - Jesse

title: Beth Kane
gameText: Adds 3 to one Team's OCCULT INVESTIGATION or adds 2 to one Team's ALIEN INVESTIGATION skill check.
dialogue: "Doctor Larson gave him vitamin shots. He gave them to a lot of kids. He said it was like treating their teeth with fluoride… as a preventative measure." - Beth Kane

title: Adam Pierce
gameText: Adds 3 to one Team's SCIENCES or adds 2 to one Team's ALIEN INVESTIGATION skill check.
dialogue: "I wish I could explain. Daniel and I, uh… I always played Salieri to his Mozart. I was never quite on his plane of intellect, but this time I found him slipping into madness, the way he began to control the others."

title: Danielle Manley
gameText: Adds 3 to one Team's CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION or adds 2 to one Team's EVIDENCE COLLECTION skill check.
dialogue: "I had this dream… had it many times. That they put Neech in that chair and they flipped the switch, but that he wouldn't die. They couldn't kill him. He's a powerful man." - Danielle Manley

title: Doctor Lorenz
gameText: Adds 3 to one Team's MEDICAL or adds 2 to one Team's BEHAVIORAL skill check.
dialogue: "High serotonin levels have been associated with mania." - Doctor Lorenz

title: Chrissy Giorgio
gameText: Play to change the Site Prerequisite to ALIEN INVESTIGATION 3+.
dialogue: "I'm in a room… on a spaceship… surrounded by aliens." - Chrissy Giorgio

title: Pam
gameText: Play to change the Site Prerequisite to BEHAVIORAL 3+
dialogue: "Usually, you walk right by. You'll pass a few minutes earlier a few minutes later-- little details, they change. But it always ends the same." - Pam

title: Arthur Dales
gameText: Play to change the Site Prerequisite to CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION 3+.
dialogue: "You don't have much time to get to the airport but if you're the X-Files man you say you are you better get your butt in gear." - Arthur Dales

title: Unnatural Illusion
gameText: Negate any one Keyword ALIEN, ALIEN MANIPULATION or ALIEN INVESTIGATION card.
dialogue: "This is an interesting dream. Wake up. Come on, Artie." - Arthur Dales

title: Third Elder's Deliberation
gameText: During the Briefing Phase, remove one Game Effect token on any Agent that normally starts with at least one token. You may only have one of this card in your Bureau deck. Remove this card from play.
dialogue: "Protection against what?" - Third Elder

title: Revitalizing Rest
gameText: During the Briefing Phase, place one token on one Agent you control that normally starts with at least one token. This token is usable in the same way that starting tokens can be used. Remove this card from play.
dialogue: "Mulder: I thought you said you were on vacation. Scully: "I am. I'm up in Maine."

title: One Breath
gameText: Play this card to search through your Bureau Deck and add any one Event card to your hand. Show your opponent which card you have added. Shuffle your deck.
dialogue: "For me, life went at a proper pace. There were many rewards… until the moment that I knew, I… understood that… that I would never see you again… my little girl. Then my life felt as if it had been the length of one breath, one heartbeat." - William Scully

title: Deny Everything
gameText: Play this card immediately after your opponent asks you a question. You may respond with this phrase: "I can neither confirm nor deny that assumption." After playing this card remove it from the game.
dialogue: "We have a vaccine. Developed by the Russians, stolen by Krycek, given to me." - The Well-Manicured Man

title: Government Watchlist
gameText: Place this card on your opponent's Field. As long as this card is in play, your opponent must play with all of the [CP] cost cards in his hand face up on the table. Place three counters on this card when it comes into play. Remove one counter each of the attached Agents' Briefing Phases. When the last counter is removed, discard this card.
dialogue: "Names of people the federal government is tracking using the US census." - Skinner

title: Manhole Surprise
gameText: Play this card to search though your Bureau deck for any one Keyword BLUFF card. Add the card to your hand and reveal it to your opponent. Shuffle your deck.
dialogue: "Oh, crap!" - Mulder

title: William
gameText: Apply a +2 modifier to any skill check made by a Team of Agents in the Field during the Investigation phase.
dialogue: "I am scared for you, Mulder. And for William. The forces against us are unrelenting." - Scully

title: Emily
gameText: Apply a +1 modifier to any skill check made by a Team of Agents in the Field during the Investigation phase.
dialogue: "Have you ever seen Mr. Potato head?" - Mulder

title: Henry Weems
gameText: Apply a +3 modifier to any skill check made by a Team of Agents in the Field during the Investigation phase.
dialogue: "What if he got really, really lucky? That's your big scientific explanation, Scully?" - Mulder

title: Secret Protection
gameText: Play this card during the Investigation phase (before any Combat has taken place) to search your Bureau Deck for any one card with the keyword COMBAT. Add the card to your hand and reveal it to your opponent. Shuffle your Bureau deck. If the card is playable this turn, you can do it for zero cost.
dialogue: "You're free to go, of course. The choice is still yours." - The Cigarette-Smoking Man

title: FBI Credentialed
gameText: Play this card to add the Keyword FBI to any Agent in play (your choice) until the end of the turn.
dialogue: So, this is Johnny Fabulous, huh? - Gabe Rotter

title: Agent on Demand
gameText: Search through your Bureau Deck and select an Agent with a Cost of 3 or less (X) and place it in the Bureau section. If this card is negated, remove it as well as the selected Agent from the game. During the Briefing Phase, pay X upkeep or discard this card and the selected Agent. Ignore Agent's Game Effect.
dialogue: "Craig, it looks like we got some invited guests…" - Mulder

title: Unstoppable Pursuit
gameText: Play this card during the Case Assignment phase to move one Agent in a Team assigned to a Site to another Team in the Field assigned to a different Site.
dialogue: "Crump? Is this what happened to your wife? This same thing? If you stop moving, you die?" - Mulder

title: Second Chance Memories
gameText: Play this card during the Investigation Phase. If a Team of Agents you control fails the Site prerequisite skill check, you may recover up to two cards played on that Site from your Discard Pile (your choice), including Combat cards, but you cannot play them again this turn.
dialogue: "The Smoking Man's dead." - Skinner

title: Deal Master
gameText: Play this card during the Briefing Phase to double the cost of one [RP] card you had discarded this turn in order to gain an equal number of [CP]'s to your conspiracy pool.
dialogue: "It's not the cards. It's playing the hand you were dealt. Well, you guys get a bad deal, it's all in what you do with it. You know what I'm saying, pardner?" - Mr. Burt

title: Krycek's Deadly Ultimatum
gameText: Play this card to force any opponent to skip the Healing phase.
dialogue: "I have a vial that contains a vaccine. Mulder knows of it. His father developed it to fight the alien virus." - Krycek
createdBy: Alfredo Sánchez, Robert Czepiel, Greg Fremaux

title: Agent Pathogen Treatment
gameText: Play this card to negate any Keyword ALIEN MANIPULATION card or to heal 1 point of damage on any Agent in the Hospital.
dialogue:
"First Elder: "What good was that knowledge? Without the vaccine against the black oil, no one can survive."
Well Manicured Man: "We have a vaccine. Developed by the Russians, stolen by Krycek, given to me."
createdBy: Alfredo Sánchez, Robert Czepiel, Greg Fremaux

title: Section Chief Scott Blevins Assassinated
gameText: If your opponent uses Agent Blevins as RES 2, while being in the Bureau during the Briefing Phase, Agent Blevins is instantly killed and removed from the game.
dialogue: "Blevins had been on payroll for four years to a biotechnology company called Roush, which is somehow connected to all this." - Skinner

title: Scully's Cancer
gameText: Play this card to force Agent Dana Scully's Team to make a BUREAUCRACY 4+ skill check. If they fail, move Scully to the Hospital immediately with zero HEALTH. Scully's recovery rate will be 1 damage token per turn. Attach this card to Scully as a reminder until she is fully healed. You can negate this card by using the Alien Pathogen Treatment card.
dialogue: "… matching the DNA from this virus with that which I believe has caused my cancer." - Scully

title: Agent Krycek, Killed by Skinner
gameText: If your opponent includes Agent Krycek in any skill check in the Field, Agent Krycek is instantly killed and removed from the game.
dialogue: "It's going to take more bullets than you can… ever fire to win this game. But one bullet… and I can give you a thousand lives." - Alex Krycek

title: Truthful Journey
gameText: You may move up to two Agents from the Bureau Section to the Field immediately. This card may not be played once an Adversary has forced combat until after the combat is resolved. If two Agents are moved, they must join the same Team in the Field.
dialogue: "Do you see anything at all?" - Doggett

title: God's Blessing
gameText: Place this card in the Field. Once during your turn as Directed player you may pay 2 [CP] to move the top card of your opponent's Bureau deck into their Discard Pile. Your opponent may pay 7 [RP] to force you to discard this card.
dialogue: "We're doing God's work, Diana. Without this immunity, everyone would die. This knowledge is God's blessing." - The Cigarette Smoking Man

title: Three Words, One Solution
gameText: Play this card to discard all [CP] tokens from your opponent's pool. The first card with [CP] cost played by your opponent may be played for free this turn.
dialogue: "The cavalry just arrived"- Frohike

title: Fox Mulder, Abducted
gameText: Play on a Team of Agents including Fox Mulder to immediately place that Agent ten cards down, face up, in the owning player's Bureau deck. Any equipment and/or token that Mulder had is discarded. When Mulder's card reaches the top of the deck, the Agent's card must be immediately moved to the Hospital (undamaged).
dialogue: "So you think he was abducted?" - Doggett

title: Tricky Trick
gameText: Play this card immediately after you have received a "yes" answer to the X-File Characteristic. You may take one [RP] card from your Discard Pile and add it to your hand.
dialogue: "May I have complete silence, please?" - Maleeni

title: Fortune's Pick
gameText: Play this card to search through your Bureau Deck and add any one Event card with activator ACTIVE to your hand. Show the card to your opponents. Shuffle your deck.
dialogue:
"Mulder: Gee! Very nice. How'd you do that?
Scully: "Well… magic."

title: Alien Relic Unveiled
gameText: Play on one Agent to allow that Agent to use their EVIDENCE COLLECTION skill number for any one ALIEN INVESTIGATION or SCIENCES skill check.
dialogue: "Yes, get me the international operator, please. I need to place a call to the United States." - Dr. Merkmallen

title: Langly
gameText: Negate one Bluff card attached to a Site (before the Bluff cost has been paid). If there are several Bluffs, choose one to be discarded randomly. The Bluff's owner may choose not to play any of the remaining Bluffs attached and discard them.
dialogue:
Langly: "Check it out, Mulder. I had breakfast with the guy that shot John F. Kennedy".
Mulder: "Is that so?"
Langly: "Old dude, but yeah, said that he was dressed as a cop on the grassy knoll."

title: Lucky Keyword Unlock
gameText: Play on one Team in the Field. If the Team makes a COMPUTER skill check 5+, then they may add 2 to any Site skill check. Discard this card after you have used the modifier.
dialogue:
Mulder: "Vegreville."
Kurt Crawford: "We're in."

title: Three of a Kind
gameText: You may use this card to place up to six cards under it (face down) at any time. These cards cannot contain the Activator CONSPIRACY. You can play cards from here as if they were in your hand, with their cost increased by 1. Discard all cards if this card is negated. Each player may only have one of this card in their deck.
dialogue: "You know, Byers, growing old with us ain't so bad." - Byers

title: The Great Mutato
gameText: Play this card during the Case Assignment phase and place it in the Field. Discard this card to negate one ADVERSARY card played by your opponent this turn (or discard it in any case at the end of the Debriefing Phase).
dialogue: "The experiments he attempted were too advanced for his understanding. The results of his experiments – unsatisfactory." - The Great Mutato

title: Trust_no1@mail.com
gameText: Select one card from your Discard Pile with the Keyword CONSPIRACY and place it in your hand. You cannot use the card this turn.
dialogue: "If I see, or suspect that you're not working alone I will terminate our communication." - Shadow Man

title: Dio Ti Ama
gameText: Place this card in your field. The cost of all [RP] cards you play this turn is halved (rounded up). Discard this card at the end of this turn. Each player may only have one of this card in their deck.
dialogue:
Scully: "She found me."
Mulder: "So you could save her."

title: Finger's Distorted Hypnosis
gameText: Play on any Witness card just played to change one skill (and its Keyword) listed on that card to any other skill (your choice) until the end of this turn.
dialogue: "I'm surrounded by men. Some are in uniforms, some are in suits." - Chrissy Giorgio

title: Finger's Hypnotic Recall
gameText: Play on any Witness card just played to change one skill (and its Keyword) listed on that card to any other skill (your choice) until the end of this turn.
dialogue: "You are feeling very sleepy, very relaxed As your body calmly drifts deeper and deeper into a state of peaceful relaxation…" - Doctor Fingers

title: Long-Range Combat Training
gameText: Play on an Agent in the Bureau. The Agent is taken out of play for one full turn. At the start of the Briefing Phase of the second turn, the Agent may be deployed as normal and in addition has a +2 in LRC skill. Place this card below the Agent to remind you of the increased skill.
dialogue: "Are we talking kung-fu movies, Mulder?" -Scully

title: Tandem Investigations
gameText: Play this card when Agent Bill Patterson is about to use his Game Effect and only if Agent Nemhauser is in his same Team. Patterson's LRC and CRC skills are doubled during the Combat. Any opponents sent to the Hospital as a result of Patterson's LRC damage do not cause him any damage that round.
dialogue: "He bit me! The son of a bitch bit me like a dog!" - Nemhauser

title: Undercovered Broadcast
gameText: Put this card in your Bureau section. Add 1 [CP] to your [CP] pool for every Event card you play as Directed player.
dialogue: "I've been thinking about this whole situation, y'know? And I think you're right. I think we won this one, I think we should just move on." - Mulder

title: Tracking the Trail
gameText: Put this card in your Bureau section. Add 1 [RP] to your [RP] pool for every Event card you play as Active player.
dialogue: "They use this magnetic strip to track you, Whenever you go through a metal detector at an airport, they know exactly how much you're carrying." - Byers

title: Life From Ashes
gameText: Play this card to heal all damage done to an Agent only if their HEALTH is reduced to zero after a Combat. The Agent can still contribute with their skills to the Site skill check this turn.
dialogue: "I want you to rise. Rise up and heal!" - Samuel
createdBy: Alfredo Sánchez, Robert Czepiel, Greg Fremaux

title: Drowned Resources
gameText: Play this card to discard all Keyword RESOURCE cards in play.
dialogue: "Do me a favor, Mulder. Let me say it. Reincarnation." - Scully

title: Fight Fire With Fire
gameText: Play this card any time after Phoebe Green's game effect token has been removed. Place a new token on Green's card. Remove this card from the game.
dialogue: "One tends not to make the same mistake twice." - Phoebe Green

title: Deceptive Visions
gameText: During this turn, you may change the BELIEVER, SKEPTIC, or NEUTRAL keyword of any one Agent in play to another of these keywords. If the Agent does not already have one of these keywords, you may add one of them to the Agent.
dialogue: "I tore this off my New York Knicks T-shirt. It has nothing to do with the crime." - Mulder

title: Cocoon
gameText: Play this card to return target Equipment card to the owner's hand.
dialogue:
Mulder: "It's amazing how things change, isn't it?"
Scully: "The Caterpillar?
Mulder: "No, a change for us. It's coming"

title: Covering up Evidence
gameText: Play this card to return one Keyword RESOURCE card to the owner's hand.
dialogue: "They called me in tonight …and they said they're going to reassign us to other sections." - Mulder

title: A Bit of Light
gameText: Play on an Agent to allow that Agent to use their EVIDENCE COLLECTION skill number for any CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION Or BEHAVIORAL skill check.
dialogue: "It's here! Here!" - Frank Briggs

title: Last Dial Inquiry
gameText: Discard a card from your hand. During your next Briefing Phase, draw two additional cards (in addition to the one you would normally draw). Ignore the effects of any card that prevents you from doing so.
dialogue: "I need to know the last call made from this booth." - Mulder

title: Donnie's Deadly Game
gameText: This card can only be played during the Case Assignment Phase to return a Site card played by your opponent back to their hand.
dialogue:
Satin: "You want me to shampoo my hair?"
Donnie: "I'm happy to pay extra, if that's something out of the ordinary."

title: Deep Throat's Demise
gameText: Play this card to empty both player's pools ([RP] and [CP]).
dialogue: "You and Mulder are the only ones that can bring it to light." - Deep Throat

title: FBI Recruit's From Quantico
gameText: Once per turn you can pay 4 [RP] to recruit an FBI cadet Agent. Use a token to represent this Agent that can be used to join a Team using these skills: LRC: +2, CRC:+2 and HEALTH: 3. If this card is negated, the token remains. If the Agent is sent to the Hospital, remove it from play. Only one Agent token can be in play.
dialogue: "I'll see you Monday" – Scully

title: Visions of Homicide
gameText: Play this card to allow you to look the top five cards of your opponent's Bureau deck. You can perform this action at the beginning of your opponent's Briefing Phase.
dialogue: "Oh my god. I'm taking her to the hospital." - Brian Tillman

title: Time Rush
gameText: Place this card in the Field. At the beginning of each player's Debriefing Phase, each player must draw one card from their Bureau Deck and then discard one card from their Bureau Deck. Afterwards, both players must reduce their hand to seven cards, as usual.
dialogue: "Time acceleration is an equation, Mulder, a theory." - Scully

title: Voodoo Unleashed
gameText: Play on one Team in the Field. If the Team makes an OCCULT INVESTIGATION skill check 5+, then they may add 2 to any Site skill check. Discard this card after you have used the Modifier.
dialogue: "Au nom des saints… et de la lune. Au nom des saints et des étoiles." - Colonel Wharton

title: Ashen Whispers
gameText: Play this card on any Agent in a Team including Agent Charles Burk to use that Agent's COMPUTER skill number for any one EVIDENCE COLLECTION or OCCULT INVESTIGATION skill check.
dialogue: "It's called vibuti - holy ash. Technically, it's known as an apport - something that materializes out of thin air." - Charles Burk
createdBy: Alfredo Sánchez, Robert Czepiel, Greg Fremaux

title: Witch Hunter
gameText: Search through your Bureau deck and play any one Witness card with the Keyword OCCULT INVESTIGATION at half cost (rounded up). If you successfully investigate a Site with this Witness this turn, you may search for an Equipment card from your Bureau deck and add it to your hand. Shuffle your Bureau deck afterwards.
dialogue: "Last checked out to a Dave Duran." - Scully

title: Letter From Samantha
gameText: Play this card on a Team of Agents. If the Team makes an ALIEN INVESTIGATION Skill check 5+, look through any player's Bureau deck and remove any one card from the game. Shuffle that Bureau deck afterwards. You may only have one of this card in your Bureau Deck.
dialogue: "Your sis… Samantha left this at the house for you."

title: Bruckman's Foretelling
gameText: During the Briefing Phase, place a token on Clyde Bruckman's card only once the starting token has been removed. This token is usable in the same way as the starting token. Remove this card from the game.
dialogue:
Mulder: "How do you know where to go?"
Bruckman: "I just know."
Mulder: "But how do you know?"
Bruckman: "I don't know!"

title: Eluding the Oubliette
gameText: Play this card to remove one token, for each 3 spent on it, from any Bluff card that forces any Agent to remain in any section of the game (or removed from the game).
dialogue: "Who are you? What do you want? Why are you doing this? Please… I want to go home." - Amy

title: Electro-Chemical Link
gameText: Attach this card to an Agent you control and place two tokens on it. During each Briefing Phase, remove one token to add +2 to that Agent's RES value. Discard this card when all tokens are removed.
dialogue: "Everything about insects is fascinating. They are truly remarkable creatures. So beautiful, and so honest." - Bambi Berembaum

title: Astral Alignment Anomaly
gameText: Attach this card to any Agent when a Game Effect token is being removed. The token is removed from that Agent without effect. Remove all remaining tokens from that Agent. This Agent may not have any Game Effect tokens as long as this card is in play. This card may not be negated. Each player may only have one of this card in their deck.
dialogue: White: "Maybe we solve the mystery of the horny beast."

title: Krycek's Amputation
gameText: Play on Agent Krycek when he is in the Field and is involved in an ALIEN INVESTIGATION or BUREAUCRACY skill check. Krycek loses his right arm and all his skills are halved (rounded up). This card cannot be negated and remains attached to Krycek until the end of the game.
dialogue: "I'm sorry…Nyet! I am American…and I've been falsely accused of spying." - Alex Krycek
